title: CAS Space performs Kinetica-2 first stage hot fire test ahead of first launch and cargo demo
summary:
China’s CAS Space completed a hot fire test of its Kinetica-2 rocket’s first stage, targeting a maiden orbital launch later this year.
The post CAS Space performs Kinetica-2 first stage hot fire test ahead of first launch and cargo demo appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Earth from Space: East Kalimantan, Borneo
Belgian endive, meatballs and microgravity
summary: When ESA astronaut Raphaël Liégeois flies to the International Space Station, he will carry with him not only scientific experiments and mission objectives, but also a comforting memory of home in the form of two beloved Belgian dishes.

title: French SSA company Look Up raises 50 million euros
summary:
Look Up, a French space situational awareness company, has raised nearly 50 million euros ($57.6 million) to continue development of a radar network to track space objects.
The post French SSA company Look Up raises 50 million euros appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Europe Looks to Space Resilience, Autonomy Amid Global Changes
summary: The European Union and the European Space Agency are emphasizing the need for European readiness to use and protect space assets and ensure autonomy for access to space as global […]

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 23 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Vandenberg SFB
summary: The Starlink 15-6 mission will add another 26 satellites into SpaceX’s low Earth orbit constellation. Teams are targeting liftoff from pad 4E at 6:54 p.m. PDT (9:54 p.m. EDT, 0154 UTC).

title: House appropriators advance defense bill, slam White House for budget delay
summary:

title: Logos nets $50 million to advance plans for more than 4,000 broadband satellites
summary:
Logos Space Services has raised $50 million to advance engineering plans for more than 4,000 broadband satellites, the startup founded by a former Google executive and NASA project manager announced June 12.
The post Logos nets $50 million to advance plans for more than 4,000 broadband satellites appeared first on SpaceNews.
